criteria: Ability to translate word problems into algebraic inequalities.
Accuracy in graphing the solution set of the inequality.
Interpretation of the solution set in the context of the problem.
descriptions: No attempt to translate the word problem into an inequality.
Attempts to translate the word problem, but the resulting inequality is incorrect or incomplete.
Translates the word problem into an inequality with minor errors or omissions.
Correctly translates the word problem into an appropriate algebraic inequality.
Correctly translates complex word problems into appropriate algebraic inequalities, demonstrating a strong understanding of the relationships between quantities.
Demonstrates mastery in translating complex and nuanced word problems into accurate algebraic inequalities, exhibiting a comprehensive understanding of quantitative relationships.
No attempt to solve the inequality.
Attempts to solve the inequality, but makes significant errors in algebraic manipulation.
Solves the inequality with some errors in algebraic manipulation, leading to an incorrect solution set.
Correctly solves the inequality, arriving at the correct solution set.
Solves inequalities involving multiple steps and rational numbers accurately and efficiently.
Exhibits mastery in solving complex inequalities, including those with rational coefficients and multiple steps, demonstrating precision and efficiency.
No attempt to graph the solution set.
Attempts to graph the solution set, but the graph is incorrect or incomplete.
Graphs the solution set with minor errors, such as incorrect endpoints or shading.
Correctly graphs the solution set of the inequality on a number line.
Graphs the solution set accurately and clearly, using appropriate notation to indicate inclusion or exclusion of endpoints.
Demonstrates mastery in graphing solution sets of complex inequalities, providing clear and precise visual representations of the solution, and using appropriate mathematical notation.
No attempt to interpret the solution set in the context of the problem.
Attempts to interpret the solution set, but the interpretation is unclear or inaccurate.
Provides a basic interpretation of the solution set, but lacks depth or context.
Correctly interprets the solution set in the context of the problem, providing a clear and relevant explanation.
Provides a thorough and insightful interpretation of the solution set, demonstrating a strong understanding of the problem context.
Offers a comprehensive and nuanced interpretation of the solution set, demonstrating a deep understanding of the problem context and its implications.
